sub_title: Senior Conflict Prevention, Mediation and Negotiation Expert | MfN-register Mediator | Trainer | Coach
summary:
After 14 years of working as a conflict resolution professional and 22 years as a trainer, coach and lecturer for different organisations, I decided to start contributing to others through my own company Mediacio.

Throughout my career my passion is to understand and work with the deeper motivations and needs of people in their actions, decisions and ‘stuckness’. It is my intention to facilitate trauma-informed processes in which people can learn, develop and heal. And in which they feel they can take ownership in the steps they want to take.  

I strongly belief that everyone can learn how to deal with (inner) conflicts and their underlying emotions, we just weren’t taught how. When you know its principles, dynamics and the specific root causes of the situation you are in, and you dare to look and feel inside yourself and really listen to the other, the keys are there to create change.

My expertise:
Mediation and conflict transformation | international negotiation and mediation | diplomacy | women & youth peace and security | leadership development | change management | trauma healing | breath work | intercultural dialogue | education management | peace education

I work through:
training | conflict coaching |  life coaching | mediation | group facilitation | Technology of Participation (ToP) | ACT coaching | trauma & breath work methods 

#transformation #conflictresolution #changemanagement #leadership # lifecoaching #training #mediation #negotiation #traumainformed

education.field_of_study: Conflict Resolution and Governance (Political Science Master)
Cultural Anthropology & Non-Western Sociology, minor Conflict studies, minor Middle Eastern studies

profile_positions.description:
Through my company Mediacio I facilitate (conflict) transformation processes, trauma-informed healing and leadership development, using different tools and techniques I have been trained in and have used  over the years. For the last 14 years I have been working within both the training & development as the peacebuilding field, as a lead trainer & lecturer, life and conflict coach, mediator, and dialogue facilitator.

Conflict is usually looked at as something negative. But it can also be seen as a chance to alter a situation into something new.  That is, if you are willing to broaden your perspective and look for alternatives to where you are now. Together with the other or on a deeper personal level. It could open up possibilities you did not think of before if you dare to touch the difficult issues. Through training sessions, in-depth analysis of the situation, mediation and/or group facilitation I support people in their search for opportunities of change and creating peace. In both the international conflict  and security field (peace negotiations/mediations, national dialogue processes) and the Dutch society.

Furthermore, I work with those that are 'stuck' in a conflict situation or in their daily life. With the help of ACT (Acceptance and Commitment Therapy), Polyvagal Theory, Focusing, Breathwork and participatory TOP methods of ICA, I help people in learning how to deal with the obstacles that they are facing in a  more flexible way (acceptance). Through conflict coaching I help to focus on objectives they want to reach. By uncovering what truly drives people, by being in contact with underlying feelings and thoughts through trauma-informed life coaching, we work towards acting with commitment towards objectives and improvement of life.

Have a look at my website to learn more on what I could bring to you: www.mediacio.nl (soon also in English).
profile_positions.title: Trainer, Coach, Mediator  and Facilitator in Social and Conflict Transformation
Senior trainer en coach in persoonlijk en mindful leiderschap

profile_positions.description: As a senior policy advisor  for the Dutch Ministry of Defense I worked at the Conflict Prevention Unit of the Directorate International Affairs (DIA).  Here I developed policy options on issues related to Africa, in cooperation with the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the Ministry of Justice. Main responsibility: coordinator Strategic Foresight and Direction process on conflict dynamics in Afrika and its inpact on Dutch security, resulting in writing a policy framework Afrika for the Dutch MoD for the upcoming 1-5 year,. Other files: Conflict Sensitivity within the Dutch forces, Military Diplomacy, Education on Conflict Prevention and Status of Forces Agreements (SoFA's).
profile_positions.title: Senior Policy Advisor on Early Warning and Conflict Prevention, working with  Strategic Foresight

profile_positions.description:
I worked as a Senior Training and Research Fellow at the Academy of the Clingendael Institute, where I initiated, developed and conducted training programmes for the multi-annual project ‘Negotiation and Mediation Training as a Conflict Resolution Instrument’.  

I trained and coached representatives of groups in conflict, (insider) mediators, and Mediation Support Units in understanding and knowing conflict resolution skills - foremost negotiation and mediation - and strategic policy planning, and I facilitated learning processes how to consciously adapt peace-building to a changing (conflict) situation when necessary. Furthermore, I developed the curriculum and my own materials , always tailor-made to the context working with. 

Examples of my work are, among many others: mediation training for African Women Mediators (FemWise/AU), insider mediation for signatories of the Nationwide Ceasefire Agreement in Myanmar (Joint Monitoring Ceasefire Committee) and leaders in the Bangsamoro society (Philippines), ToTs on mediation and dialogue curriculum (ECOWAS Mediation Facilitation Division and for Insider Mediators - UNDP) and mediation and dialogue facilitation for cross-border Local Peace Committees from Kenya and Ethiopia (in cooperation with IGAD/CEWARN). 

Furthermore, I conducted courses for (foreign) diplomats, humanitarian aid workers, civil servants and other professionals within the Clingendael International Skills Programme. My training and coaching include topics like (the skills of) international negotiation, (peace) mediation, inclusivity in peace processes, conflict analysis, dealing with deadlocks and trust-building, reconciliation, and related peace and security issues. Furthermore, I am coaching different negotiation trainers within the Academy and am responsible for further improvement of our training methodology, for examples by writing the 'Mediation Support Guide' and am doing acquisition.
profile_positions.title: Senior Training and Research Fellow Clingendael Academy

profile_positions.description:
At the Academy of the Clingendael Institute I work as a Training and Research Fellow in the International Skills Programme. Here I design training courses and provide training sessions for international diplomats and groups in conflict in the skills of international negotiation, (peace) mediation and conflict analysis.

During peace talks, success and failure at the negotiation table are largely determined by the negotiation skills of the representatives of conflicting groups or the facilitation skills and expertise of the mediator. Yet in conflict resolution the importance of the stakeholders’ negotiation and mediation capacity in achieving a successful outcome is often underestimated. Enhancing the right skills and knowledge of parties involved in peace processes can greatly increase the chances of success.

Since November 2014 Clingendael Academy started the multi-annual training facility "Negotiation and Mediation Training as a Conflict Resolution Instrument". These training projects target representatives of groups in conflict and (inside) mediators in order to enhance their negotiation and mediation capacities. As such, I am one of the program developers and trainers within the facility. We give training in cooperation with different international organisations, such as the UNDP, ECOWAS and the African Union, and I have been conducting trainings in Europe, Asia, Africa and the Middle East.
profile_positions.title: Training and Research Fellow

profile_positions.location: Institute for Interdisciplinary Studies and College Social Sciences, University of Amsterdam
profile_positions.description:
Program Manager and Associate Lecturer  - International University Course: Soliya - Part of the Minor Conflict Studies and the Minor Midden-Oosten at the University of Amsterdam
 
As a associate lecturer and program manager I am responsible for the Soliya Connect Program on the University of Amsterdam:
- Soliya's Connect Program offers students from Europe, the United States, the Middle East and Asia an unique opportunity to research and discuss the differences and similarities between their worlds. A mixture of information sources and the format of video conferencing will be used to accommodate an intercultural dialogue. The interdisciplinary nature of the course will greatly improve the students' understanding of intercultural relations.
- Additionally, students will be challenged to acquire journalistic skills by compiling a video item for Soliya News Network and Common Ground News Service. Furthermore, students will develop skills in intercultural and/or interreligious dialogue and conflict resolution.
- Themes that will be discussed in the classroom vary from the role of religion in society, the "Clash of Civilizations", dialogue, conflict resolution with regards to social psychology, the role of the media in identity questions, the Israeli-Palestinian conflict, and nonviolent resistance in the Middle East.

Furthermore, over the years I worked for Soliya as a facilitator in dialogue between international students and as a facilitators' coach.

For more information about the Soliya programme, please refer to: www.soliya.net
profile_positions.title: SOLIYA -Program Manager and Associate Lecturer - Minor Conflict, Minor Middle Eastern Studies

profile_positions.description:
- At the program of Algemene Sociale Wetenschappen I teach and develop various courses of the first and second year from an interdisciplinary perspective. This program offers a broad curriculum based on Cultural Anthropology, Sociology, Political Science, Social Geography, Social Psychology and other disciplines. As a teacher I am responsible for our student to acquire the right academic Social Sciences' skills to finally be able to accomplish their studies in a profound way.
- Moreover, I am tutoring my own students during the course of their studies; I give them study advice, assist them in their learning process, and guide them with choosing their domain/major and minor, and if necessary I redirect them to other university services.
- In their third year students have to write their bachelor thesis; I am one of the thesis supervisors of the conflict studies domain/major of the study program of Algemene Sociale Wetenschappen. In a half year study group students are conducting interdisciplinary quantitative and/or qualitative research under my supervision.

I (co)teach the following courses:
- Interdisciplinary Course on Social Sciences (1st yr)
- Course on Behavior and Society (1st yr)
- Exploration of In- and Exclusion (1st yr)
- Visions on Modernity (2nd yr)
- Visions on Social Inequalities (2nd yr)
profile_positions.title: Lecturer, Tutor and Thesis Supervisor at Algemene Sociale Wetenschappen Bachelor

profile_positions.location: Institute for Interdisciplinary Studies (University of Amsterdam)
profile_positions.description:
Honours Course - Dark Side of Democracy
- Together with Dr. Bernard Kruithof I was the lecturer of the course Dark Side of Democracy, which belongs to the Honours Programme of the University of Amsterdam. The main objective of the course is to gain a profound understanding of one of the leading theories in the field of genocide studies, Michael Mann's book in which he explains that murderous ethnic cleansing is the ‘dark side of democracy'. Mann claims in his book The Dark Side of Democracy that there may be a correlation between the rise of democracy and the outburst of ‘ethnic cleansing'. 
- The course is characterized by a multi- and interdisciplinary perspective: we encourage students to study murderous ethnic cleansing from different academic perspectives, e.g. history, sociology, psychology, law, and political science.

Beta-Gamma Bachelor Academic Skills
- First year students of this bachelors program learn the elementary skills that are needed within their academic studies. A whole semester I taught them the practical abilities of academic writing, argumentation/debating and communication competences, interview techniques, how to present papers and an academic poster, and how to pose critical questions.
profile_positions.title: Lecturer (Honours Programme UvA and Beta-Gamma Bachelor)

profile_positions.description:
As coach and trainer I am responsible for the support of my trainees in the realization of a project. They want to make 'a change in the world'. I coach groups of young people in various skills and knowledge:
- Personal growth and  development of skills in project management, effective (intercultural) cooperation and communication, and the full realization of their new project. 
- The projects of the pairs of trainees focus on the realization of a sustainable environment in their (religious) community. Sustainable ways of the use of energy, the change towards sustainable products at home and in the community, and the perspective on the worldwide environmental problems are the main aspects of realization within the projects.
- Main idea: To reduce, to change, to compensate!

This Changemakers Program and 'Jongeren Geloven in Duurzaamheid' is part of the Youth Development Program Togetthere of the Dutch NGO's ICCO, KiA and Edukans.
profile_positions.title: Trainer and Coach Changemakers Programme

company.name: ASPIRE (Advancement of Sustainable Participatory Initiatives for Reconciliation and Empowerment)

profile_positions.company: ASPIRE (Advancement of Sustainable Participatory Initiatives for Reconciliation and Empowerment)
profile_positions.description:
- Training and consulting local and international NGO’s in the field of conflict management, peace education and empowerment, supporting implementation, monitoring and evaluation
- 2011 – Training of Trainers on “Implementing peace education for youth empowerment and sustainable development” for CARE International in Pakistan, Reach out to Asia (ROTA) and IDEA, Islamabad, Pakistan
profile_positions.title: Founder, programme manager and trainer

profile_positions.description:
The NGO Critical Mass facilitates extra-curricular education to high school children and professionals in the education industry on different social processes as conflicts, discrimination, in- and exclusion, etc. By doing so, they connect various groups of people with innovative ways of transferring knowledge (www.criticalmass.nu).
My tasks as a trainer have been the following:
- Trainer of new volunteers in presentation skills, and how to deal with children of different age, cultural background and learning level.
- Organizer and teacher of training sessions for professionals on several subjects like learning styles, populism, dynamics and actors in post-conflict situations, leadership, etc. 
- Trainer and developer educational program in conflict resolution, Hogeschool van Utrecht.

Additionally I have been trained at Critical Mass in the innovative method of conflict transformation for social change, named KUMI. The KUMI method is developed in Israel/Palestine where it has been succesful in creating viable  communities from Palestinians and Israelis. 
www.criticalmass.nu and www.transform-centre.org
profile_positions.title: Trainer

company.name: The institute for Interdisciplinary Studies (University of Amsterdam)

profile_positions.location: The Institute for Interdisciplinary Studies (University of Amsterdam)
profile_positions.description:
The Institute for Interdisciplinary Studies of the UvA develops and facilitates interdisciplinary education. Students are offered the possibility to combine various academic fields or to merge science with the practical professional field (www.iis.uva.nl).

- As the assistant of both the Education Coordinator of the Honours and Electives Program as the Programme Manager of a Research Master in Brain and Cognitive Sciences I could refine my skills in the development, implementation and facilitation of academic courses.

- Within my job I was responsible for the monitoring and evalution of courses and the program that was offered, the facilitation of the curriculum, and the organization of academic events and meetings. Even more, I had to maintain the promotion and website facilities. As the first person at hand I was the intermediary between the institute, students, lecturers and the coordinator/manager.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Programme Manager and Education Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
Programme coordinator of the exchange program of the University of Amsterdam (UvA) with Kalamoon University, School of International and Diplomatic Relations, Syria. Within this program students from both universities cooperated to explore various case studies around the topic of ‘Conflict Resolution and Peace Negotiations; Negotiating an end to Violence’.

- I was accountable for the coordination of the study program for the Syrian delegation before, and during, their visit to the Netherlands. Furthermore, my responsibilities were to manage the budget, to compose the academic content of the program, and to liaise with external partners.

- Moreover, I was in charge of selecting and supervising the Dutch student participation, as well as supporting them and the senior staff (professor and project-manager) throughout the preparations and during the visit to Syria. The whole processes requested a high cultural sensitivity and a thoughtful customization of the program to the needs of all parties involved.
profile_positions.title: Programme Coordinator Syria - Zeytun Academic Exchange

volunteer_experiences.role: Facilitator, Intercultural Dialogue US, EU and Middle East.

“Stelt bewoners van Amsterdam in staat zelf conflicten in hun omgeving op te lossen. 
Conflicten in een wijk of buurt hebben een slechte invloed op de leefbaarheid. 
Onbegrip of angst zijn vaak onnodig oorzaak van diverse misverstanden. Het inschakelen van politie of ander gemeentelijke instanties heeft niet altijd het gewenste effect. Praten, respect opbrengen voor elkaar, kan een oplossing brengen.”

Beterburen is een stichting die bemiddelt in burenconflicten zodat klachten tussen buren weer bespreekbaar worden en er naar passende oplossingen gezocht kunnen worden.
